docs.snippet: As the mainstream news media work to separate fact from fiction, Facebook — which has gobbled up much of the online ad market — must do its part....
docs.lead_paragraph: As the mainstream news media work to separate fact from fiction, Facebook — which has gobbled up much of the online ad market — must do its part.
docs.abstract: Jim Rutenberg Mediator column maintains Facebook has special responsibility to take on role as defender of truth since social network has become major news source.

headline.main: Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook Must Defend the Truth
headline.print_headline: Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook Must Step Up to Defend Truth

docs.snippet: As Democrats pick through the wreckage of the campaign, one lesson is clear: The election was notable as much for the people who did not show up, as for those who did....
docs.lead_paragraph: As Democrats pick through the wreckage of the campaign, one lesson is clear: The election was notable as much for the people who did not show up, as for those who did.
docs.abstract: Some residents of Election District 15 in Milwaukee discuss their reasons for not voting in election; area, populated mostly by blacks and known for its high rates of poverty and incarceration, experienced 19.5 percent drop in voter turnout from 2012; many cite disillusionment with Pres Obama and presidential contenders as reasons for not voting; city's election commission says new state photo ID requirement may have also contributed to decline by preventing thousands from voting.

headline.main: Many in Milwaukee Neighborhood Didn’t Vote — and Don’t Regret It
headline.print_headline: ‘Both of Them Were Terrible’:  No Vote, No Regrets in Milwaukee

byline.contributor: Michael Wines contributed reporting from New York.
